basic.floral_language:
Crassula rupestris 'Tom thumb'
Floriography: meticulous, lucky, warm.
Crassula 'Tom Thumb' is a miniature succulent plant with tiny triangular leaves in opposing ranks stacked on upright stems.  The mint green to light green leaves have colorful reddish edges with red dots especially in bright light. The unique shape gains popularity as ornamental potted plant indoor or outdoor.
The plant is a full sun plant. Summer dormant, protect from direct sunlight. It is topped by clusters of tiny white flowers in spring.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, often flowers in spring, white flowers
basic.color: Leaf color gray green to pale green, when sunny leaf edges turning to red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Like sunshine, resistant to half shade, short period of dormancy in summer, use half shade for better care
maintenance.watering: Do not water frequently, keep a dry environment, water every 7-10 days, reduce water in dormancy
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring, autumn, and winter
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
